text:
#ALERTA Pueblo de Venezuela y Comunidad Internacional:
Desde las 2:24 am funcionarios del SEBIN asedian las casas del Diputado y jefe de fracción de VP Sergio Vergara y el Jefe de mi Despacho, abogado Roberto Marrero.
En estos momentos los mantienen secuestrados en el sitio.

html: Secuestraron a @ROBERTOMARRERO, jefe de mi despacho. El denunció a viva voz que le sembraron dos fusiles y una granada, se lo dijo al diputado @SergioVergaraG, su vecino. El procedimiento comenzó a las 2 am aprox. Desconocemos su paradero. Debe ser liberado de inmediato.

html: The #FY2019 THUD bill, which I helped craft, allocated $3.2B for highway infrastructure. #Florida will receive $132M of that, which will be used to repair & upgrade our state’s roads & bridges. This is on top of the nearly $100M FL received in the #FY2018 bill.

html: I thank @maxschachter, who tragically lost his son at Parkland, for his ongoing commitment to this issue. He worked diligently with my staff and I to include language in this funding bill, encouraging schools to use federal grant money for these hardening measures.
text: I thank @maxschachter, who tragically lost his son at Parkland, for his ongoing commitment to this issue. He worked diligently with my staff and I to include language in this funding bill, encouraging schools to use federal grant money for these hardening measures.

html: Metal detectors + other deterrents can help prevent another devastating incident like Parkland from happening again. The legislation also ensures school districts and local law enforcement officers have the proper resources to mitigate + respond to emergency and crises situations
text: Metal detectors + other deterrents can help prevent another devastating incident like Parkland from happening again. The legislation also ensures school districts and local law enforcement officers have the proper resources to mitigate + respond to emergency and crises situations

html: This legislation includes $100 million for the STOP School Violence Act, of which I was a co-sponsor of and was signed into law last year by President Trump. This grant program is a critical investment for localities who seek to improve their school hardening capabilities.
text: This legislation includes $100 million for the STOP School Violence Act, of which I was a co-sponsor of and was signed into law last year by President Trump. This grant program is a critical investment for localities who seek to improve their school hardening capabilities.

html: On the anniversary of the Parkland tragedy, I am honored to say we approved additional funding for school safety in tonight’s government funding bill.
text: On the anniversary of the Parkland tragedy, I am honored to say we approved additional funding for school safety in tonight’s government funding bill.

html: I congratulate @RepKayGranger @NitaLowey. It’s because of their willingness to negotiate in good faith that we were able to reach this bipartisan agreement. I look forward to working with them + our colleagues to begin the FY20 process to fund critical programs families rely on.

text:
BUT! That’s not all the bill includes. Other items important to #SoFla:
•$37.5 billion to help mom and pop #smallbiz through @Sbagov 7(a) and 504 loan programs 
•$1.01B to combat citrus greening and other invasive species harming Florida’s iconic crop and our farmers+growers

html: Community Development Block Grants (CDBG) + the Home Investment Partnership Program, which allow municipalities to expand access to affordable housing, continue to see strong $ levels. I recognize the importance of ensuring our neediest receive the housing and care they need.
text: Community Development Block Grants (CDBG) + the Home Investment Partnership Program, which allow municipalities to expand access to affordable housing, continue to see strong $ levels. I recognize the importance of ensuring our neediest receive the housing and care they need.

html: In respect to housing, the bill prioritizes funding for our most vulnerable populations, helping the elderly, disabled individuals, veterans, and those living with HIV/AIDS.
text: In respect to housing, the bill prioritizes funding for our most vulnerable populations, helping the elderly, disabled individuals, veterans, and those living with HIV/AIDS.

html: Just one example:Over $800M is provided for Transit Infrastructure Grants, including $350M for Bus+Bus Facilities Grants that support our local public bus systems. @MiamiDadeCounty received 2 grants from this program last yr + will hopefully see further dollars in the coming year

html: In fact, Southern Florida has already reaped the benefits of these programs in the previous year, and I am confident we will continue to see investments made in our communities this year. #SoFla
text: In fact, Southern Florida has already reaped the benefits of these programs in the previous year, and I am confident we will continue to see investments made in our communities this year. #SoFla

html: The legislation continues the strong levels of funding for BUILD grants, Capital Investment Grants, + Airports and Highway Grants, allowing localities like those in @CollierPIO, Hendry County, + @MiamiDadeCounty to compete for federal money to upgrade and expand their facilities
text: The legislation continues the strong levels of funding for BUILD grants, Capital Investment Grants, + Airports and Highway Grants, allowing localities like those in @CollierPIO, Hendry County, + @MiamiDadeCounty to compete for federal money to upgrade and expand their facilities

html: I’m proud of my work to support Florida’s seaports and I look forward to building on this program in the future. Sailing away from ports and into other #transport items in this bill...
text: I’m proud of my work to support Florida’s seaports and I look forward to building on this program in the future. Sailing away from ports and into other #transport items in this bill...

html: This seaport funding will have a direct benefit to the Sunshine State. $93 million is set aside for the top 15 container ports, which includes both @PortMiami @PortEverglades, with priority given to projects with a critical issue both ports face - fumigation fees.
text: This seaport funding will have a direct benefit to the Sunshine State. $93 million is set aside for the top 15 container ports, which includes both @PortMiami @PortEverglades, with priority given to projects with a critical issue both ports face - fumigation fees.

html: Over the past year I heard from so many port authorities in Florida and across the nation on the need for a dedicated port funding pool. That’s why nearly $300 million is delivered in this legislation to improve our nation’s seaports.
text: Over the past year I heard from so many port authorities in Florida and across the nation on the need for a dedicated port funding pool. That’s why nearly $300 million is delivered in this legislation to improve our nation’s seaports.

html: It furthers historic levels of funding to repair our nation’s aging infrastructure. It’s continued progress towards revitalizing our roadways, bridges, airports, transit systems, and for the first time, our seaports!
text: It furthers historic levels of funding to repair our nation’s aging infrastructure. It’s continued progress towards revitalizing our roadways, bridges, airports, transit systems, and for the first time, our seaports!

html: Once again, I urge Democratic leadership to consider a real solution to ending the shutdown, whether it be one of my proposals or that of another Member of Congress, that will have a fair chance at Senate consideration and becoming law.

html: My amendment not only gets us closer to reopening our government, but also protects our national security, addresses vulnerable immigrant communities who seek legal status, and helps those who are rebuilding after Hurricane Michael.

html: Expanding transit in our community is critical to alleviating the traffic and gridlock that we face daily, and I am grateful for these much-needed dollars.

html: The BUILD grant will help support continued growth+expansion of the South-Dade Transitway corridor. Specifically, the grant will help increase capacity at two park-and-ride facilities along the corridor, directly supporting the County TPO’s vote to move toward bus-rapid transit.
text: The BUILD grant will help support continued growth+expansion of the South-Dade Transitway corridor. Specifically, the grant will help increase capacity at two park-and-ride facilities along the corridor, directly supporting the County TPO’s vote to move toward bus-rapid transit.

html: True to my word, in my working with the Administration and with the County’s application moving forward at DOT, here is the first installment of federal dollars to compliment the implementation of the SMART Plan.

html: As the County continues to work with DOT, specifically the Federal Transit Administration, on the project development phase of the South Corridor Rapid Transit Project, I stand ready to assist in any way possible.

html: For years, I’ve told the County that I am willing and able to help fund their transit needs, once a viable plan had been submitted. To their credit the County has finally taken real, tangible steps forward w the SMART Plan over the last several months, & I commend their progress.
